summary: The SMTP Email plugin connects ChurchCRM to your email server so all outgoing notifications, password resets, event reminders, and reports are delivered reliably.

sections.title: Quick Setup
sections.content:
1. Enable the plugin.
2. Click the Gmail or Outlook preset button to pre-fill common settings, or enter your server details manually.
3. Enter your SMTP Username and Password.
4. Click "Save Settings", then "Test Connection" to verify everything works.

sections.title: Gmail Setup
sections.content:
Use the Gmail preset button, then:
• Username: your full Gmail address (e.g. yourname@gmail.com)
• Password: create an App Password at myaccount.google.com/apppasswords (2-Step Verification must be enabled)

Note: Google requires an App Password — your regular Gmail password will not work with SMTP.

sections.title: Outlook / Microsoft 365 Setup
sections.content:
Use the Outlook preset button, then:
• Username: your full Microsoft email address
• Password: your Microsoft account password

For Microsoft 365 business accounts, your administrator may need to enable SMTP AUTH for your mailbox.

sections.title: Custom SMTP Server
sections.content:
Enter your provider's hostname, port, and credentials. Common ports:
• 25  — Unencrypted (not recommended)
• 587 — STARTTLS (recommended for most providers)
• 465 — SSL/TLS

Check your hosting provider's documentation for the correct values.

sections.title: Test Connection
sections.content: The "Test Connection" button sends a real email to your church address with full SMTP debug output so you can diagnose any connection issues. The debug log is shown inline after the test.
